properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the affinity group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the affinity group.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The affinity group type. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to register this affinity group to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the disk volume. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: attach
properties.description: • attach - (Optional) Determines whether or not to attach the disk volume to a virtual machine (defaults false).

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: • device_id - (Optional) The device ID to map the disk volume to within the guest OS.

properties.name: disk_offering
properties.description: • disk_offering - (Required) The name or ID of the disk offering to use for this disk volume.

properties.name: size
properties.description: • size - (Optional) The size of the disk volume in gigabytes.

properties.name: shrink_ok
properties.description: • shrink_ok - (Optional) Verifies if the disk volume is allowed to shrink when resizing (defaults false).

properties.name: virtual_machine_id
properties.description: • virtual_machine_id - (Optional) The ID of the virtual machine to which you want to attach the disk volume.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) The name or ID of the zone where this disk volume will be available. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The network ID for which to create the egress firewall rules. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: managed
properties.description: • managed - (Optional) USE WITH CAUTION! If enabled all the egress firewall rules for this network will be managed by this resource. This means it will delete all firewall rules that are not in your config! (defaults false)

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times. Each rule block supports fields documented below. If managed = false at least one rule is required!

properties.name: parallelism
properties.description: • parallelism (Optional) Specifies how much rules will be created or deleted concurrently. (defaults 2)
The rule block supports:

properties.name: cidr_list
properties.description: • cidr_list - (Required) A CIDR list to allow access to the given ports.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The name of the protocol to allow. Valid options are: tcp, udp and icmp.

properties.name: icmp_type
properties.description: • icmp_type - (Optional) The ICMP type to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP.

properties.name: icmp_code
properties.description: • icmp_code - (Optional) The ICMP code to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Optional) List of ports and/or port ranges to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is TCP or UDP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: ip_address_id
properties.description: • ip_address_id - (Required) The IP address ID for which to create the firewall rules. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: managed
properties.description: • managed - (Optional) USE WITH CAUTION! If enabled all the firewall rules for this IP address will be managed by this resource. This means it will delete all firewall rules that are not in your config! (defaults false)

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times. Each rule block supports fields documented below. If managed = false at least one rule is required!

properties.name: parallelism
properties.description: • parallelism (Optional) Specifies how much rules will be created or deleted concurrently. (defaults 2)
The rule block supports:

properties.name: cidr_list
properties.description: • cidr_list - (Required) A CIDR list to allow access to the given ports.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The name of the protocol to allow. Valid options are: tcp, udp and icmp.

properties.name: icmp_type
properties.description: • icmp_type - (Optional) The ICMP type to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP.

properties.name: icmp_code
properties.description: • icmp_code - (Optional) The ICMP code to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Optional) List of ports and/or port ranges to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is TCP or UDP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the instance.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Optional) The display name of the instance.

properties.name: service_offering
properties.description: • service_offering - (Required) The name or ID of the service offering used for this instance.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Optional) The ID of the network to connect this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The IP address to assign to this instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: template
properties.description: • template - (Required) The name or ID of the template used for this instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: root_disk_size
properties.description: • root_disk_size - (Optional) The size of the root disk in gigabytes. The root disk is resized on deploy. Only applies to template-based deployments. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) The group name of the instance.

properties.name: affinity_group_ids
properties.description: • affinity_group_ids - (Optional) List of affinity group IDs to apply to this instance.

properties.name: affinity_group_names
properties.description: • affinity_group_names - (Optional) List of affinity group names to apply to this instance.

properties.name: security_group_ids
properties.description: • security_group_ids - (Optional) List of security group IDs to apply to this instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: security_group_names
properties.description: • security_group_names - (Optional) List of security group names to apply to this instance. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) The name or ID of the zone where this instance will be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: start_vm
properties.description: • start_vm - (Optional) This determines if the instances is started after it is created (defaults true)

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance. This can be either plain text or base64 encoded text.

properties.name: keypair
properties.description: • keypair - (Optional) The name of the SSH key pair that will be used to access this instance.

properties.name: expunge
properties.description: • expunge - (Optional) This determines if the instance is expunged when it is destroyed (defaults false)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: is_portable
properties.description: • is_portable - (Optional) This determines if the IP address should be transferable across zones (defaults false)

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Optional) The ID of the network for which an IP address should be acquired and associated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Optional) The ID of the VPC for which an IP address should be acquired and associated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Optional) The name or ID of the zone for which an IP address should be acquired and associated. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
NOTE: network_id and/or zone should have a value when is_portable is false! NOTE: Either network_id or vpc_id should have a value when is_portable is true!
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the loadbalancer rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the load balancer rule.

properties.name: ip_address_id
properties.description: • ip_address_id - (Required) Public IP address ID from where the network traffic will be load balanced from. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Optional) The network ID this rule will be created for. Required when public IP address is not associated with any network yet (VPC case).

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: • algorithm - (Required) Load balancer rule algorithm (source, roundrobin, leastconn). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: private_port
properties.description: • private_port - (Required) The private port of the private IP address (virtual machine) where the network traffic will be load balanced to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: public_port
properties.description: • public_port - (Required) The public port from where the network traffic will be load balanced from. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Optional) Load balancer protocol (tcp, udp, tcp-proxy). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: member_ids
properties.description: • member_ids - (Required) List of instance IDs to assign to the load balancer rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the network.

properties.name: display_text
properties.description: • display_text - (Optional) The display text of the network.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Required) The CIDR block for the network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: • gateway - (Optional) Gateway that will be provided to the instances in this network. Defaults to the first usable IP in the range.

properties.name: startip
properties.description: • startip - (Optional) Start of the IP block that will be available on the network. Defaults to the second available IP in the range.

properties.name: endip
properties.description: • endip - (Optional) End of the IP block that will be available on the network. Defaults to the last available IP in the range.

properties.name: network_domain
properties.description: • network_domain - (Optional) DNS domain for the network.

properties.name: network_offering
properties.description: • network_offering - (Required) The name or ID of the network offering to use for this network.

properties.name: vlan
properties.description: • vlan - (Optional) The VLAN number (1-4095) the network will use. This might be required by the Network Offering if specifyVlan=true is set. Only the ROOT admin can set this value.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Optional) The VPC ID in which to create this network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: acl_id
properties.description: • acl_id - (Optional) The ACL ID that should be attached to the network or none if you do not want to attach an ACL. You can dynamically attach and swap ACL's, but if you want to detach an attached ACL and revert to using none, this will force a new resource to be created. (defaults none)

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: source_nat_ip
properties.description: • source_nat_ip - (Optional) If set to true a public IP will be associated with the network. This is mainly used when the network supports the source NAT service which claims the first associated IP address. This prevents the ability to manage the IP address as an independent entity.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) The name or ID of the zone where this network will be available. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the ACL. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the ACL. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) The ID of the VPC to create this ACL for. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: acl_id
properties.description: • acl_id - (Required) The network ACL ID for which to create the rules. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: managed
properties.description: • managed - (Optional) USE WITH CAUTION! If enabled all the firewall rules for this network ACL will be managed by this resource. This means it will delete all firewall rules that are not in your config! (defaults false)

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Optional) Can be specified multiple times. Each rule block supports fields documented below. If managed = false at least one rule is required!

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: parallelism
properties.description: • parallelism (Optional) Specifies how much rules will be created or deleted concurrently. (defaults 2)
The rule block supports:

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Optional) The action for the rule. Valid options are: allow and deny (defaults allow).

properties.name: cidr_list
properties.description: • cidr_list - (Required) A CIDR list to allow access to the given ports.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The name of the protocol to allow. Valid options are: tcp, udp, icmp, all or a valid protocol number.

properties.name: icmp_type
properties.description: • icmp_type - (Optional) The ICMP type to allow, or -1 to allow any. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP. (defaults 0)

properties.name: icmp_code
properties.description: • icmp_code - (Optional) The ICMP code to allow, or -1 to allow any. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP. (defaults 0)

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Optional) List of ports and/or port ranges to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is TCP, UDP, ALL or a valid protocol number.

properties.name: traffic_type
properties.description: • traffic_type - (Optional) The traffic type for the rule. Valid options are: ingress or egress (defaults ingress).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The ID of the network to plug the NIC into. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The IP address to assign to the NIC. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_machine_id
properties.description: • virtual_machine_id - (Required) The ID of the virtual machine to which to attach the NIC. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: ip_address_id
properties.description: • ip_address_id - (Required) The IP address ID for which to create the port forwards. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: managed
properties.description: • managed - (Optional) USE WITH CAUTION! If enabled all the port forwards for this IP address will be managed by this resource. This means it will delete all port forwards that are not in your config! (defaults false)

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to create this port forward in. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: forward
properties.description: • forward - (Required) Can be specified multiple times. Each forward block supports fields documented below.
The forward block supports:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The name of the protocol to allow. Valid options are: tcp and udp.

properties.name: private_port
properties.description: • private_port - (Required) The private port to forward to.

properties.name: public_port
properties.description: • public_port - (Required) The public port to forward from.

properties.name: virtual_machine_id
properties.description: • virtual_machine_id - (Required) The ID of the virtual machine to forward to.

properties.name: vm_guest_ip
properties.description: • vm_guest_ip - (Optional) The virtual machine IP address for the port forwarding rule (useful when the virtual machine has secondairy NICs or IP addresses).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: • gateway - (Required) the gateway of the Private gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Required) the IP address of the Private gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: netmask
properties.description: • netmask - (Required) The netmask of the Private gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vlan
properties.description: • vlan - (Required) The VLAN number (1-4095) the network will use.

properties.name: physical_network_id
properties.description: • physical_network_id - (Optional) The ID of the physical network this private gateway belongs to.

properties.name: network_offering
properties.description: • network_offering - (Optional) The name or ID of the network offering to use for the private gateways network connection.

properties.name: acl_id
properties.description: • acl_id - (Required) The ACL ID that should be attached to the network.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: • vpc_id - (Required) The VPC ID in which to create this Private gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - (Optional) The IP address to bind the to NIC. If not supplied an IP address will be selected randomly. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: nic_id
properties.description: • nic_id - (Optional) The NIC ID to which you want to attach the secondary IP address. Changing this forces a new resource to be created (defaults to the ID of the primary NIC)

properties.name: virtual_machine_id
properties.description: • virtual_machine_id - (Required) The ID of the virtual machine to which you want to attach the secondary IP address. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the security group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the security group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to create this security group in. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: security_group_id
properties.description: • security_group_id - (Required) The security group ID for which to create the rules. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (Required) Can be specified multiple times. Each rule block supports fields documented below.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project in which the security group is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: parallelism
properties.description: • parallelism (Optional) Specifies how much rules will be created or deleted concurrently. (defaults 2)
The rule block supports:

properties.name: cidr_list
properties.description: • cidr_list - (Optional) A CIDR list to allow access to the given ports.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The name of the protocol to allow. Valid options are: tcp, udp, icmp, all or a valid protocol number.

properties.name: icmp_type
properties.description: • icmp_type - (Optional) The ICMP type to allow, or -1 to allow any. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP. (defaults 0)

properties.name: icmp_code
properties.description: • icmp_code - (Optional) The ICMP code to allow, or -1 to allow any. This can only be specified if the protocol is ICMP. (defaults 0)

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Optional) List of ports and/or port ranges to allow. This can only be specified if the protocol is TCP, UDP, ALL or a valid protocol number.

properties.name: traffic_type
properties.description: • traffic_type - (Optional) The traffic type for the rule. Valid options are: ingress or egress. (defaults ingress)

properties.name: user_security_group_list
properties.description: • user_security_group_list - (Optional) A list of security groups to apply the rules to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the SSH key pair. This is a unique value within a CloudStack account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: • public_key - (Optional) The public key to register with CloudStack. If this is omitted, CloudStack will generate a new key pair. The key can be loaded from a file on disk using the file() function. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to register this key to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: ip_address_id
properties.description: • ip_address_id - (Required) The public IP address ID for which static NAT will be enabled. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: virtual_machine_id
properties.description: • virtual_machine_id - (Required) The virtual machine ID to enable the static NAT feature for. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vm_guest_ip
properties.description: • vm_guest_ip - (Optional) The virtual machine IP address to forward the static NAT traffic to (useful when the virtual machine has secondary NICs or IP addresses). Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Required) The CIDR for the static route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: gateway_id
properties.description: • gateway_id - (Required) The ID of the Private gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the template.

properties.name: display_text
properties.description: • display_text - (Optional) The display name of the template.

properties.name: format
properties.description: • format - (Required) The format of the template. Valid values are QCOW2, RAW, and VHD.

properties.name: hypervisor
properties.description: • hypervisor - (Required) The target hypervisor for the template. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type - (Required) The OS Type that best represents the OS of this template.

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Required) The URL of where the template is hosted. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to create this template for. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Optional) The name or ID of the zone where this template will be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: is_dynamically_scalable
properties.description: • is_dynamically_scalable - (Optional) Set to indicate if the template contains tools to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory (defaults false)

properties.name: is_extractable
properties.description: • is_extractable - (Optional) Set to indicate if the template is extractable (defaults false)

properties.name: is_featured
properties.description: • is_featured - (Optional) Set to indicate if the template is featured (defaults false)

properties.name: is_public
properties.description: • is_public - (Optional) Set to indicate if the template is available for all accounts (defaults true)

properties.name: password_enabled
properties.description: • password_enabled - (Optional) Set to indicate if the template should be password enabled (defaults false)

properties.name: is_ready_timeout
properties.description: • is_ready_timeout - (Optional) The maximum time in seconds to wait until the template is ready for use (defaults 300 seconds)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the VPC.

properties.name: display_text
properties.description: • display_text - (Optional) The display text of the VPC.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Required) The CIDR block for the VPC. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vpc_offering
properties.description: • vpc_offering - (Required) The name or ID of the VPC offering to use for this VPC. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_domain
properties.description: • network_domain - (Optional) The default DNS domain for networks created in this VPC. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to deploy this instance to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) The name or ID of the zone where this disk volume will be available. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the VPC for which to create the VPN Gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the VPN Customer Gateway.

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: • cidr - (Required) The CIDR block that needs to be routed through this gateway.

properties.name: esp_policy
properties.description: • esp_policy - (Required) The ESP policy to use for this VPN Customer Gateway.

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: • gateway - (Required) The public IP address of the related VPN Gateway.

properties.name: ike_policy
properties.description: • ike_policy - (Required) The IKE policy to use for this VPN Customer Gateway.

properties.name: ipsec_psk
properties.description: • ipsec_psk - (Required) The IPSEC pre-shared key used for this gateway.

properties.name: dpd
properties.description: • dpd - (Optional) If DPD is enabled for the related VPN connection (defaults false)

properties.name: esp_lifetime
properties.description: • esp_lifetime - (Optional) The ESP lifetime of phase 2 VPN connection to this VPN Customer Gateway in seconds (defaults 86400)

properties.name: ike_lifetime
properties.description: • ike_lifetime - (Optional) The IKE lifetime of phase 2 VPN connection to this VPN Customer Gateway in seconds (defaults 86400)

properties.name: project
properties.description: • project - (Optional) The name or ID of the project to create this VPN Customer Gateway in. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: customer_gateway_id
properties.description: • customer_gateway_id - (Required) The Customer Gateway ID to connect. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vpn_gateway_id
properties.description: • vpn_gateway_id - (Required) The VPN Gateway ID to connect. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
